item.description:
We're planning to hike one of the most challenging hike in WHITES/NH - "1 day Pemi Loop Hike" on July 2nd (Sat) by staying at the campsite on 7/1(Fri) & 7/2(Sat) before/after hike. This hiking event will be completed on 7/3(Sun) morning.

 

Before you sign up, please read the entire event description carefully.  When/what time you sign up on this event really does NOT matter because you'll be staying on the Waiting List anyway for a while.

As this hiking event is strenuous and challenging, we (event organizers) are going to screen if hikers on the waiting list have enough hiking experience to join us and complete 32miles 1 day hike with us.

After you read and understand what is required completely, please sign up. Then, you'll be asked several questions.  If we don't see your answers for them, you won't have a chance to join our hike at all.

 

Hiking Description:

Pemi Loop is approximately 32 miles foot trail which covers 8 4000 footers at Pemigewasset Wilderness in NH.

 

We start from Lincoln Woods Trail from Lincoln Woods Visitor Center Parking lot.  Our hike goes clockwise with the following mountains in this order.

1. Mt Flume (4328 ft)

2. Mt Liberty (4459 ft)

*. Little Haystack Mtn (4780 ft, but, it's not counted as 48 4K footers by AMC)

3. Mt. Lincoln (5089 ft)

4. Mt Lafayette (5260 ft)

5. Mt Garfield (4500 ft)

6. South Twin Mtn (4902 ft)

7. Mt Bond (4698 ft)

8. Bondcliff (4265 ft)

Book Time is 21 Hours 49 mins but we'd like to complete under book time.

There are 2 more 4K peaks nearby which are Galehead Mtn (4024 ft) & West Bond (4540 ft) but each of them require additional 1 miles RT hike to reach its summit.  So there is NO plan to go there on this event. 

 

Requirement to join this hiking event:

1. We expect hikers who join us can keep up with 2mph hiking pace in overall.   If our average pace is 2pmh, we can complete this challenging long distance hike by 16 hours. (Beat Book Time about 5+hours)

2. Since we're planning to start hiking VERY EARLY MORNING (like 5AM) on 7/2(Sat), this event requires hikers to stay campsite on 7/1 Friday night. Once we read your answers against to our questions, we'll contact you through email individually.  We'll explain the cost of campsite. Once you send us check, we'll move you to "On Going" list.

We booked one tent site where 4 adults can stay at maximum.  We can try to book one more tent site depending on the number of hikers.  Larger a hiking group gets, slower hiking pace will be, in general.  Therefore, we prefer to hike with a small group which is up to 6-8 people at most.

We don't provide tent etc.  So you're expected to have your own tent, camping gear, and foods etc. to cook and eat.

 

3. We may want to car spot at certain location(s) of trailhead just in case when we have to give up our hike in the middle due to some reasons. (ex. Garfield Trail TH, Gale River Tr TH and/or North Twin Tr TH etc.) So we get together on 7/1(Fri) evening at the campsite and we car spot on Friday night before we sleep.

 

4. 32miles hike per a day is very long hike.  So we'll be back to the same campsite on Sat night to stay one more night.  On Sunday morning, after we eat breakfast, we pick up our cars in car spot location(s).   Then, this event will be completed.   So you'll need to have time available from Friday evening  to Sunday morning to join this event.  No exception.

 

5. You're expected to hike as a group.  If you're faster than anybody else, you'll need to slow down or wait for us frequently in every single trail junction at least.

 

Note:

1. This is weather dependent hike since we don't want to hike 32miles during miserable weather. We may cancel this event due to bad weather forecast.

 

2. We, event organizers, will not be able to access internet for 2 weeks between 6/13-25.  We're probably able to access internet and contact you after 6/26.  So please be patient.... 

 

If you have any questions, please feel free to drop me an email.

Assistant Organizer

Ken Hodges

Tomoko Nakajima

==========================================

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: 1 Day Pemi Loop Hike in WHITES on Sat & Fri/Sat night camping
